title: Election deniers are changing how midterm ballots will be counted in this state
description: In Nevada, 2020 election deniers are already changing the way 2022 midterm ballots will be counted. CNN's Kyung Lah reports.

title: This country is becoming the first to ban foreign models in ads
description: Nigeria is banning foreign models and voice-over artists effective October 1. Segun Arinze, president of the Association of Voice-Over Artists in Nigeria, defended his country's move during an interview with CNN's Lynda Kinkade.

title: Don Lemon on Duchess of Sussex's 'eye-opening' podcast on race
description: Meghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex discusses her biracial identity with Mariah Carey on her latest podcast. CNN's Don Lemon joins Brianna Keilar and John Berman to discuss her thoughts on race.

title: Family of fallen U.S. Marine re-files defamation lawsuit against Alec Baldwin in New York
description: The family of fallen U.S. Marine Rylee J. McCollum has re-filed their lawsuit against actor Alec Baldwin for defamation in New York, according to a complaint filed Friday.

title: Monkees' drummer Micky Dolenz is suing the FBI
description: The Monkees' only surviving group member, Micky Dolenz, has filed a lawsuit against the FBI for any records that may involve him, his late bandmates, or the band itself.

title: Gorbachev's moral authority did little to stop Putin
For the first time in 25 years, August will not have a named storm -- if we make it to the end of the day without one
description: It isn't your imagination. The topics in the Atlantic have been very quiet this year despite a forecast from NOAA and other experts forecasting an above-average season.

title: The Monkees have an FBI file and the last surviving member wants it released
description: Micky Dolenz, the last surviving member of The Monkees, is suing the FBI for the full release of the bureau files on the band and all of its members.

title: 'An occupational hazard': Florida wildlife director loses hand after alligator bite
description: The wildlife director at a wildlife park in Florida lost his hand after being bitten by one of his own alligators last week, according to the facility. It was his second serious alligator-related injury in 10 years.

title: Trump weighs delaying 2024 decision as political and legal troubles grow
description: Donald Trump is considering waiting until after the November midterms to launch a third presidential campaign as he navigates a widening array of legal troubles and mounting concerns that some of his hand-picked Senate candidates may be weaker than he once thought, sources familiar with his thinking tell CNN.

title: As Ukraine pushes to retake the south, families fear being caught in the crosshairs
description: When the Russian invasion began, Maria Pokusaeva knew that she wouldn't leave her home in southern Ukraine, despite being close to the front lines of the conflict.

title: Pakistan emits less than 1% of the world's planet-warming gases. It's now drowning
Toddler dies after being hit by giant hailstone in Spain
description: A 20-month-old girl has died after being struck on the head during a violent hailstorm that caused havoc in Catalonia, northeastern Spain, authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Serena Williams' singles career continues on against world No. 2 Anett Kontaveit at US Open
Crist to resign from Congress as race for Florida governor heats up
description: A week after winning the Democratic primary for Florida governor, Rep. Charlie Crist will resign from his seat in the US House effective at the end of Wednesday, his campaign confirmed.

title: Hear what ex-FBI special agent noticed in evidence photo taken inside Trump's home
description: CNN reporter and former FBI special agent Josh Campbell breaks down the evidence photo, which was arranged and taken by law enforcement, that shows classified documents seized from Trump's residence.

title: Ashton Kutcher lost 12 pounds training for a marathon
description: Ashton Kutcher is training for the upcoming 2022 TCS New York City Marathon and reveals he's lost weight in the process.

title: Snapchat to lay off more than 1,200 staffers, or 20% of global headcount
description: Snap Inc., the parent company of the popular app Snapchat, announced plans to lay off some 20% of its more than 6,400 global employees.

title: From mesh to the 'wet look', what to wear in sweaty weather
description: Sweat, on its face, is the enemy of good style -- it smells, clings and discolors, sending delicate pieces to the cleaners and essential clothing to the damp bottom of the laundry hamper.

title: Justice Department responds in court to Trump's bid for special master in Mar-a-Lago case
description: Former President Donald Trump should not be allowed to intervene in the federal investigation that led to the search of his Mar-a-Lago resort, and a "special master" should not be appointed to the case, the Justice Department said in a blockbuster court filing Tuesday night.

title: Bruce Willis' wife Emma opens up about grief
description: National Grief Awareness Day was Tuesday and the wife of actor Bruce Willis shared some of hers.

title: 'The Lord of the Rings' delivers spectacle but lacks the dramatic power to rule them all
description: Having invested hundreds of millions in mounting a series version of "The Lord of the Rings," Amazon has gotten its money's worth in production values but not storytelling, with a handsome prequel that could leave all but the most devoted Hobbits feeling more bored than lord. "The Rings of Power" should be a source of considerable curiosity, but amid an onslaught of big-budget streaming fare, this seems undeserving to rule them all.

title: Russia's strength is artillery. Here's how it could quickly become a weakness
description: It may have started in an era of technological progress, but the Russian invasion of Ukraine shares a surprising number of similarities with conflicts from the last century. Defense expert Professor Malcolm Chalmers explains how the features of the war in Ukraine resemble tactics used in previous military conflicts.

title: Sen. Lindsey Graham continues to argue subpoena should be quashed, says election-related phone calls are protected
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham continued to argue in a court filing Wednesday that a Fulton County subpoena for his testimony in the investigation into plots to illegally influence Georgia's 2020 election results should be quashed or, at the very least, heavily limited in scope.

title: Tom Hanks is launching a trivia game on Apple Arcade
description: Tom Hanks has created a trivia game called "Hanx 101 Trivia," set to debut exclusively on Apple Arcade.

title: Ukrainian families in the crosshairs of battle for the south
Laverne Cox mistaken for Beyoncé and her response was on point
description: Laverne Cox was at the US Open recently when she started trending.

title: Research says rising temperatures decreasing global well-being
description: CNN's chief climate correspondent Bill Weir talks to John Berman about a new study that spanned 15 years and says that people who experience extreme heat also experience a decrease in their well-being.

title: Queen won't return to London to appoint new British PM, for first time in her reign
description: Queen Elizabeth II will receive the UK's next prime minister at Balmoral rather than Buckingham Palace -- a historic first for her 70-year reign.

title: Republicans voted 'no' on the climate bill. Their states will get billions of dollars from it anyway
description: Republicans in Congress unanimously opposed Democrats' $750 billion climate and health law, deriding it as a payout to "elite" and "liberal" states. But the states those Republicans represent will soon see a financial windfall in the form of billions of dollars to decarbonize the country, experts told CNN.

title: Religion linked to better measures of heart health among Black Americans, study says
description: African American adults who participate in frequent religious activities, or hold deeper spiritual beliefs, are more likely to score higher in indicators linked to good heart health than those who don't, according to new research.

title: China's Xi pushes forward to third term despite mounting crises
description: The countdown for Xi Jinping's expected coronation has officially started.

title: Gravy grappling: Wrestlers compete for world title in pools of sauce
description: The World Gravy Wrestling Championship returned to England for the 12th year, using hundreds of pounds of sauce.

title: Alaska to tabulate ranked-choice ballots as Palin attempts political comeback
description: Alaska elections officials will tabulate the state's ranked-choice ballots for the first time on Wednesday, determining whether former Gov. Sarah Palin will make a political comeback by winning a special election for the state's lone House seat.

title: What makes mosquito bites itch and what to do about it
description: If you've ever been bitten by a mosquito, you know how frustrating their bites can be. The little red bumps swell up almost immediately, creating an itch that once you start scratching only seems to get worse. The more you scratch, the more they itch -- starting a vicious cycle that can leave you irritated, sore and covered in red bumps.

title: Remember when Princess Diana danced with John Travolta at the White House?
description: Remember when Princess Diana hit the dance floor at the White House with "Saturday Night Fever" star John Travolta?

title: In photos: Diana's life and legacy
description: Twenty-five years after her untimely death, Princess Diana remains a beloved figure.

title: 'He hung himself': Why Trump and Clinton cases aren't the same thing
description: George Conway and CNN's Evan Perez discuss whether comparing the FBI's search warrant for former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago home to the probe into Hillary Clinton's unsecured server is fair.

title: Mikhail Gorbachev, ex-leader who presided over Soviet Union's collapse, dies
description: Mikhail Gorbachev -- the last leader of the former Soviet Union from 1985 until 1991 -- has died at the age of 91.

title: How Princess Diana's style legacy continues today
description: Twenty-five years after her death, Princess Diana's wardrobe continues to inspire new generations. From TikTok users painstakingly recreating her workout outfits to fashion fans sourcing cult items worn by the late royal, her style remains as influential as ever, sparking magazine photoshoots, designer runway collections and reissues of her beloved pieces.

title: 'This is so embarrassing': Woman gets stuck upside down at gym
description: A woman placed 911 call while stuck UPSIDE DOWN at the gym. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the lowdown on the upside down 911 call.

title: Water in this US city is so dirty, boiling it doesn't make it usable
description: Cassandra Welchlin, a resident and social worker in Jackson, Mississippi, says that the water in Jackson is so dirty that even though she boils it, she will not use it for cooking, bathing or brushing her kid's teeth.

title: Girl dies 5 days after being set on fire by man whose proposal she rejected, police say
description: Indian police on Tuesday formed a special investigative unit to probe the death of a girl who said she had been set on fire by a stalker whose marriage proposal she rejected, a case that has led to anger in a country where violence against women is rife.
